hackathon-description-text: A hackathon is an event that gathers programmers, computer information technologists, graphics designers, builders, and creative people with different abilities to "hack" and create a project in a limited amount of time.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Quality Assurance Developer / O'Reilly Auto Parts

hackathon-eligibility: Only students who are 16 years of age or older and currently enrolled at a high school, homeschool, college/university or have graduated within the past 12 months are eligible to attend.
hackathon-requirements: See the entry categories and criteria here:

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Native App (Mobile or Desktop) Entry
Best use of an API Entry

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1001 E Chestnut Expy, Springfield, MO 65802, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How technically impressive was the hack? Was the technical problem the team tackled difficult? Did it use a particularly clever technique or did it use many different components? Did the technology involved make you go "Wow"?

Did the team put thought into the user experience? How well designed is the interface? For a website, this might be about how beautiful the CSS or graphics are. For a hardware project, it might be more about how good the human-computer interaction is
Does the hack work? Did the team achieve everything they wanted?
Did the team stretch themselves? Did they try to learn something new? What kind of projects have they worked on before?

hackathon-location-address: 1001 E Chestnut Expy, Springfield, MO 65802, USA
hackathon-description-header: A creative invention marathon! HackTheOzarks is designed to be a beginner-friendly hackathon for students.
